intro: Pithecellobium kinabaluense, commonly known as the Kinabalu pithecellobium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are compound, with small, ovate leaflets, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
